text: Respectfully, I cover high school sports extensively. I believe sharing a report pertaining to high school closures, which was generated by the news staff at @Batavia_Daily and @TheLCN, is squarely in my lane. Respectfully, of course.
The first GLOW Region School closure.

Just had a family meeting to discuss plans and expectations during the school closure. I proposed a rule that everyone should be out of bed and dressed in daytime clothes by 9am each day. The kids were like, “You sociopathic monster, how could you even suggest such a thing?”

Mayor Bowser has extended school closures in the District of Columbia to prevent the spread of COVID-19, so KIPP DC schools will remain closed until Monday, April 27. Stay tuned for more information about remote learning. Meal distribution will continue next week as scheduled.

COVID-19 Ed Updates: @MayorBowser announced DC’s public schools will remain on distance learning until April 27th. Ban on mass gatherings still in effect. Due to school closures, @osse will seek a one-year waiver on PARCC & science exams for SY 19-20.

Important on the disparate impact continued school closures will have on vulnerable students. #COVID19 closures are necessary for public health, but we *must* attend to learning for ALL students to mitigate the lasting damage for students. True for #Ward6, for DC & nationwide.
